name: react
description:
The React plugin contains executors and generators for managing React applications and libraries within an Nx workspace. It provides:


- Integration with libraries such as Jest, Cypress, and Storybook.

- Generators for applications, libraries, components, hooks, and more.

- Library build support for publishing packages to npm or other registries.

- Utilities for automatic workspace refactoring.

unitTestRunner.description: Adds the specified unit test runner.

e2eTestRunner.description: Adds the specified E2E test runner.

schema.title: Create a React Application
schema.description: Create a React application for Nx.

examples.description: Use class components instead of functional components

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the application?

directory.description: The directory of the new application.

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

routing.x-prompt: Would you like to add React Router to this application?

skipWorkspaceJson.description: Skip updating `workspace.json` with default options based on values provided to this app (e.g. babel, style).

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.

e2eTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for end to end (E2E) tests.

tags.description: Add tags to the application (used for linting).

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. `App.tsx`).

classComponent.description: Use class components instead of functional component.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

globalCss.description: Default is `false`. When `true`, the component is generated with `*.css`/`*.scss` instead of `*.module.css`/`*.module.scss`.

strict.description: Creates an application with strict mode and strict type checking.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

schema.title: Create a React Library
schema.description: Create a React Library for an Nx workspace

examples.description: Generate a library with routes and add them to `myapp`

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the library?

directory.description: A directory where the lib is placed.

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.

tags.description: Add tags to the library (used for linting).

skipTsConfig.description: Do not update `tsconfig.json` for development experience.

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. `App.tsx`).

appProject.description: The application project to add the library route to.

importPath.description: The library name used to import it, like `@myorg/my-awesome-lib`.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

globalCss.description: When `true`, the stylesheet is generated using global CSS instead of CSS modules (e.g. file is `*.css` rather than `*.module.css`).

strict.description: Whether to enable tsconfig strict mode or not.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

schema.title: Create a React Component
schema.description: Create a React Component for Nx.

examples.description: Generate a component in the `mylib` library
Generate a class component in the `mylib` library

project.x-prompt: What is the name of the project for this component?

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the component?

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

skipTests.description: When true, does not create `spec.ts` test files for the new component.

directory.description: Create the component under this directory (can be nested).

flat.description: Create component at the source root rather than its own directory.

export.description: When true, the component is exported from the project `index.ts` (if it exists).
export.x-prompt: Should this component be exported in the project?

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. `App.tsx`).

classComponent.description: Use class components instead of functional component.

globalCss.description: Default is `false`. When `true`, the component is generated with `*.css`/`*.scss` instead of `*.module.css`/`*.module.scss`.

fileName.description: Create a component with this file name.

generators.name: redux

schema.title: Create Redux state
schema.description: Create a Redux state slice for a React project.

project.description: The name of the project to add the slice to. If it is an application, then the store configuration will be updated too.
project.x-prompt: What is the name of the project for this slice?

directory.description: The name of the folder used to contain/group the generated Redux files.

appProject.description: The application project to add the slice to.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

generators.description: Create a Redux slice for a project.

generators.name: storybook-configuration

schema.title: React Storybook Configure
schema.description: Set up Storybook for a React app or library.

configureCypress.x-prompt: Configure a cypress e2e app to run against the storybook instance?

generateStories.description: Automatically generate `*.stories.ts` files for components declared in this project?
generateStories.x-prompt: Automatically generate *.stories.ts files for components declared in this project?

generateCypressSpecs.description: Automatically generate `*.spec.ts` files in the Cypress E2E app generated by the `cypress-configure` generator.
generateCypressSpecs.x-prompt: Automatically generate *.spec.ts files in the Cypress E2E app generated by the cypress-configure generator?

cypressDirectory.description: A directory where the Cypress project will be placed. Placed at the root by default.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

generators.description: Set up storybook for a React app or library.

generators.name: storybook-migrate-defaults-5-to-6

schema.title: Storybook migrate defaults 5 to 6
schema.description: Generate default Storybook configuration files using Storybook version `>=6.x` specs, for projects that already have Storybook instances and configurations of versions `<6.x`.

all.description: Generate new Storybook configurations for all Storybook instances across all apps and libs.

keepOld.description: Keep the old configuration files - put them in a folder called `.old_storybook`.

name.description: Leave empty to upgrade all Storybook instances. Only use this if you want to do a gradual migration. Library or application name for which you want to generate the new Storybook configuration.

generators.description: Generate default Storybook configuration files using Storybook version `>=6.x` specs, for projects that already have Storybook instances and configurations of versions `<6.x`.

generators.name: component-story

schema.title: Create component story
schema.description: Generate storybook story for a react component.

project.description: The project name where to add the components.
project.x-prompt: What's name of the project where the component lives?

componentPath.description: Relative path to the component file from the library root.
componentPath.x-prompt: What's path of the component relative to the project's lib root?

generators.description: Generate storybook story for a React component

generators.name: stories

schema.title: Create React Storybook stories
schema.description: Create stories/specs for all components declared in an app or a library.

project.x-prompt: What's name of the project for which you want to generate stories?

generateCypressSpecs.description: Automatically generate `*.spec.ts` files in the cypress e2e app generated by the cypress-configure generator.
generateCypressSpecs.x-prompt: Do you want to generate Cypress specs as well?

cypressProject.description: The Cypress project to generate the stories under. This is inferred from `project` by default.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

generators.description: Create stories/specs for all components declared in an app or library.

generators.name: component-cypress-spec

schema.title: Create component Cypress spec
schema.description: Create a Cypress spec for a UI component that has a story.

project.description: The project name for which to generate tests.
project.x-prompt: What's name of the project for which to generate tests?

componentPath.description: Relative path to the component file from the library root?
componentPath.x-prompt: What's path of the component relative to the project's lib root for which to generate a test?

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

cypressProject.description: The Cypress project to generate the stories under. By default, inferred from `project`.

generators.description: Create a Cypress spec for a UI component that has a story.

schema.description: Create a React component using Hooks in a dedicated React project.

examples.description: Generate a hook in the `mylib` library

project.x-prompt: What is the name of the project for this hook?

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the hook?

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

skipTests.description: When true, does not create `spec.ts` test files for the new hook.

directory.description: Create the hook under this directory (can be nested).

flat.description: Create hook at the source root rather than its own directory.

export.description: When true, the hook is exported from the project `index.ts` (if it exists).
export.x-prompt: Should this hook be exported in the project?

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case hook file name (e.g. `useHook.ts`).
